name: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 tsp red chili powder (adjust to taste)
1/2 tsp kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves), crushed
instructions: In a bowl, marinate chicken with lemon juice, salt, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and let it rest for at least 30 minutes (or up to 4 hours in the refrigerator).
Heat oil in a large pan or pot over medium heat. Add ginger and garlic and saut√© for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add chopped onion and cook until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and cook for another 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are reduced and slightly thickened.
Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Reduce heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Stir in heavy cream, butter, garam masala, and crushed kasuri methi. Mix well and simmer for another 5-10 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with naan bread or rice.
